chapter.title: Connecting
chapter.para: NetworkManager manages wired, wireless, mobile broadband, vpn and dsl connections. It does not currently support dialup modem connections but there is help available in .

sect1.title: Wired (LAN)
sect1.para: DHCP connections (where settings are concfigured by your router) are automatically configured. Wired network connections are selected as default when connected.

sect2.title: DHCP Connections
sect2.para: Most routers use DHCP to allocate IP addresses.

listitem.para: Click the NetworkManager icon in the system notification area.
Under Wired Network click the Radio Button next to the network you want to connect to.

sect2.title: Static Connections
sect2.para: If you don't use DHCP then you can configure a static connection.

listitem.para: Right click the NetworkManager icon in the system notification area.
Click Edit Connections.
Click the Wired tab.
Select the connection and click Edit.
Click the IPv4 tab.
Choose Manual from the Method drop down.
Enter your details and click OK.
Click Close.

sect1.title: Wireless
sect1.para: Wired network connections are selected as default when connected.

listitem.para: Click the NetworkManager icon in the system notification area.
Under Wireless Network click the radio button next to the network you want to connect to.

sect1.para: If you have selected the network previously, the previous supplied details are used to connect.
New connections, will present a dialog box and in most circumstances will detect the required security type.

listitem.para: Select the WEP type from the Wireless Security drop down.
Enter the Username and Password. Ticking the Show Password will display the key.
Click the Connect.
Select LEAP from the Wireless Security drop down.
Enter the key or passphrase. Ticking the Show Key will display the key.
Select the WEP index drop down, the default is "1".
Select the authentication type from the Authentication.
Click the Connect.
Select Dynamic WEP from the Wireless Security drop down.
Select the Authentication drop down.
Choose a User Ceritificate by clicking the User Ceritificate browse button. Navigate to the certificate and click Open.
Choose a CA Ceritificate by clicking the CA Ceritificate browse button. Navigate to the certificate and click Open.
Choose a Private Key by clicking the Private Key browse button. Navigate to the certificate and click Open.
Enter the private key password. Ticking the Show Key will display the key.
Click the Connect.
Select the WEP type from the Wireless Security drop down.
Enter the password. Ticking the Show Password will display the key.
Click the Connect.

sect1.title: Mobile Broadband
sect1.para: Mobile Broadband means any kind of high speed internet connection which is provided by an external device such as a 3G usb stick or mobile phone with built-in HSPA/UMTS/GPRS data connection. Some laptops have recently been produced with mobile broadband devices already inside them.
Most Mobile Broadband devices should be recognised automatically when you connect them to your computer. Ubuntu will prompt you to configure the device.

step.para: The New Mobile Broadband Connection Wizard will open automatically when you connect the device.
Click Forward and insert your details, including the country where your Mobile Broadband device was issued, the network provider and type of connection (for example, Contract or pre-pay).
Give your connection a name (it is up to you what name you choose) and click Apply.
Your connection is now ready to use. To connect, left click the NetworkManager icon in the top right of the panel and select your new connection.

sect1.para: If you are not prompted to configure the device when you connect it, it may still be recognised by Ubuntu. In such cases you can add the connection manually.

step.para: Right click the NetworkManager icon in the top right of the panel and click Edit Connections...
This should open the New Mobile Broadband Connection Wizard. Enter your details as described above.

listitem.para: Left click the NetworkManager icon and click Configure VPN... from the VPN Connections option.
Click Add.
Right click the NetworkManager icon and click Edit connections...
Click DSL.
Click Add.
